abstract: As expected, the Treasury Department blocked the sale of Fannie Mae’s unused tax credits to Goldman Sachs late Friday, arguing that the government would lose more money on taxes than it would gain from the proposed deal.
snippet: As expected, the Treasury Department blocked the sale of Fannie Mae’s unused tax credits to Goldman Sachs late Friday, arguing that the government would lose more money on taxes than it would gain from the proposed deal.
lead_paragraph: Update | 8:23 p.m. The Obama administration on Friday evening rejected a proposal by Goldman Sachs to buy as much as $1 billion in tax credits from Fannie Mae, saying the deal would have amounted to a net loss for taxpayers, The New York Times’s Edmund L. Andrews reports from Washington.

headline.main: Treasury Rejects Sale of Tax Credits to Goldman
